title: Is it common to have lots of games played in bronze or any tier?
body:
Finals just got done and video games can be played a lot more often. My games are usually winning streaks or losing streaks. I have over a 100 games and currently in bronze 2. Losing streak right now, every game loss was because team decides to throw or not communicate. 


This is not my week for League.

replies.body: It is common for people to hit their skill cap and get stuck. If you feel like you hit a wall, its because you're no longer good enough to advance. Focus on bettering yourself so you can impact the game more the next time around. You'll never see your teammates again, so their mistakes don't matter. Remember that if you see your team making mistakes, the enemy has the same tier players. They're making mistakes too. Find the mistakes and exploit it.
If you cant get out of bronze in 10 games per division tops then you belong in bronze
And you belong in detention, if that attitude carries over to real life.

lmao... but its true! I've only been in bronze once in my life in solo q, and I got out in 6 games.

I landed in bronze 2 in flex queue and took me 8 games to get to bronze 1... its really not that hard when you actually dont belong in bronze.
It is easy when you are at the top of bronze with an MMR that gives you good gains. But tray from the bottom when the system predetermines you have to stay in bronze.
if that were true then I would never got out of silver since I obviously started this season in silver 5

You aren't out of Silver yet.
You have had 100 games so far. 

You said you should climb out in 6 games. That would be 25+LP per win and 2/3, just straight victories. I know some players are good AND lucky enough to hit a streak like that. But we are not discussing "I deserve Plat why am I in bronze." we are discussing "I am slightly better than bronze, it sucks that I have to play 100s of games to get out of bronze."

6+6+6+6+9 = 33 games (assuming you can't get 34LP, assuming no skips). Looks like you played way too many games huh. 

I am not insulting you, or the poster. I am just saying playing 100s of games is not abnormal. It sucks, but it isn't abnormal.

Also, the system didn't predetermine you to be Silver 5. It UNDERANKED you into Silver5 to force you to climb. Your situation is completely different vs someone who is predetermined to be Bronze 5 and only gains like 16LP per win. That was what my reply was. 
Your MMR is probably placed higher than Silver5. So you were able to climb decently. I assume somewhere in the middle matches started getting tougher. Then they got more normal. But idk, I haven't played your games.

Actually let's see. You couldn't get out of Silver in 10 games per division. 100/5 = 20 games. Guess you belong in Silver, you are just lucky the system might let you escape. 
Do you see how your post makes no sense?

That counter goes for flex queue too... you should take the 10 games from provisionals as well from both queues so I actually have 85 ranked games together being around 20 of those for flex queue... 

Besides what I was saying about the 10 game thing was for bronze, because in my opinion is very hard to lose in bronze unless you are not carrying. In that case you are a masochist because relying on bronze to get out of bronze is naive.

also 10 games per division is around 50 games for 85 minus the 20 of the flex is like 65 games, to be fair my rank has been gold for the past 3 seasons so for me its harder silver than bronze. But in any case I only need 6 more wins to get gold so.... im not really that far.

My point about bronze stands, if you get 16 LP per win then the system is telling you that you belong in that elo. If you lose more LP than u win then you belong lower, if you gain the same then yeah you belong in that elo.
But your point isn't right.

My point is: If you dont belong in that elo you climb fast, if it takes you 100 games in bronze and still cant get out specially if you are bronze 2... The game even rewards you for failing your promos with a free win... so there is no excuse if you are meant to climb you will climb. 

If you are struggling to gain LP then you are doing something wrong or your skill isn't worth of higher rank. 100 games is a lot already and pretty much if you spent 100 games in a division or inbetween 3 divisions or even in a whole rank then yeah you wont get far.

It depends on your approach to the game. 

If you're actively trying to improve, watching educational twitch vods, free coaching, playing the right champs, and you're still in bronze. There is a problem somewhere. 

Playing the game for purely fun is fine, nothing wrong with that. 

You really got to ask yourself, are you really trying to get out of bronze? You aren't.

It is not your teammates dude. It is you. 

You have 224 games played. Your most played champion is at 23 games. You've played 37 different champions. Your last 10 games, has 9 different champions. 

If you really wanted to get out of bronze, then just play soraka every game and always queue up as the same 2 roles. 
Here is your OP.GG
https://na.op.gg/summoner/userName=Captain+BubbleT

It is obvious that your soraka would work, but you don't play her. Just play soraka. The team comp doesn't matter. Delay your sightstone. Rush redemption. Your yellow trinket is enough early. Warding the enemy jungle doesn't really matter in your elo.

Find 2 champions in 2 roles. Don't play anything else. 

I'd suggest learning annie mid. I did that, and she taught me alot about league.
I had to played close to if not over 100 games to get out of Bronze in Flex. And I actively tried to climb. It isn't that fast to get out of bronze, despite what others get the help with.
You have the same problem as him! JUST STICK TO A COUPLE CHAMPS. IF YOU DONT. YOU DONT REALLY WANT TO CLIMB

I agree one tricks are successful. I won't disagree. If you want to truly master a champion One tricking is better, that is why I tell others to stick to one lane instead of trying to learn every lane (you can see my old posts where others say they main x champs in x lanes).

But I don't think I've done terrible. It was much slower than I wanted of course. 

I don't want to just ignore any advice, but I guess I have a bit of bad in me because I don't want to do a pure one-trick (because one-trick on my current supports would piss my team off or be boring (sorry sometimes winning if boring)). But at the same time, I only play a handful of supports and I try to stay only in support. You might think that is too many though.
By boring, I mean if I think the match-up is a losing one it is boring. If they have Soraka, my Janna is not going to do much in lane so I would consider it a boring match-up. But I will agree/admit I recently played an Ali game and told my team it has been too long and was not comfortable, but at the same time he made sense vs Rakan compared to my normal line-up.

I am not trying to ignore you or be rude. But also no reason to use caps, it feels insulting.

Having a larger pool because its more enjoyable is fine reasoning. You can't climb if you don't play the game because you don't enjoy it :P 

I guess I'm just lucky I found a champ that I could spam without getting bored.

Well if you want to play with a scrub, I wouldn't mind.

I do try to limit my support pool to the champions I am comfortable with. There are some I really like Veigar support, but without heals he is pretty situational and that is fine but teammates get pissed. And like Janna into Soraka doesn't make sense imo. Tarric makes sense vs 4-5AD etc. But I will take any advice.

Welcome to RNG simulator 2017. Your experiences here will be mostly futile and tied to matchmaking luck, patience and lemons.

I suggest you pick two champions that cover two roles well and just play them, every game, everywhere, anywhere. Being really good at a champion is far more important than any sort of meta in bronze.

Inevitably there will be bad games, but this gives you a good chance to be able to carry, or at least push your team forward to victory if you get a fairly fair match.

Another important point is sometimes you have to pull your team backwards to victory.
The defending team has a **huge advantage** in fights: they have safe places to retreat to, behind turrets and walls, they have cover to poke from behind, help clearing waves, and a shorter trip to and from the fountain.
Low-elo teams wont freeze lanes to farm and starve you, so you will actually often outfarm the attacking team as well, this can give you a chance to catch up or reach peak power for late-game champs.

just get a blue trinket so you can steal dat baron.
Last years was RNG, this years solo q has been way more balanced. I mean I still go against plats in my games when I have silver teammates but its still possible to win.

It took me some 1200 games last season before I escaped Bronze. Started Bronze 5 this season and I have already played 1000 ranked games this season and I'm still not close to getting out yet. So to answer your question, yes it is common to have lots of game in a tier.

Report shitheads and focus on your own play.  

Real talk, if you rock your role 90% of the time then you will steadily move up.

What are your LP gains and losses? I feel like this is a very important question before even discussing climbs.

The more you play, the more Riot tries to put your WR at 50%. It isn't like you are just playing vs Bronze 2s, you are playing vs people who are your "skill" to get that 50%. The system is designed to make you play many games on purpose.

I won't say 200 is a normal number. But don't feel bad if it takes a long time. Someone else just posted it took a good 150 games to go from Silver5 to Gold5 despite being gold previously.

it's easier to climb when the servers arent lagging and if you're playing with people who have similar strategies as you. i recommend playing on sundays and thursdays. you dont have to worry about those dumb mini-patches that interfere with data load and playing with people who've not updated their client yet. the people who party saturday nights by getting wasted will have slept in and thursdays they're too tired to play since they're saving their energy for friday afternoon. other than that the only way to limit frustrations is to do extremely unrealistically well so that your team will always have hope.

I had an 8-game win streak snapped after a huge early game lead because our "ADC Wukong" would not group and the enemy team was always grouped.  It would have been fine if he was able to pressure towers, but he wasn't.

That plus a few stupid calls, like we have middle inhib down on their base and they are dealing with supers, but everyone wants to "just push it down mid!" when we could have taken other lanes and actually cracked more inhibs to put MORE pressure on them.
